page.title: 04KEMPSEY'S PARISH HALL.
page.content: The pre_war parish hall is about a mile from the actual church. It was built at the start of the twentieth century and since then has become a centre of village life. Groups that are held there are:{Cornflower club, {Playgroup,Women's Institute }and even Bingo! { }As well as providing a meeting place for groups or receptions the parish hall is also the place where all the local 'gossip' is exchanged. The structure is part brick, part wood and also part metal.It comprises of a stage,a hall,a kitchen where light refreshments can be made and of course a toilet. In recent years clubs such as the Brownies and the Cubs have left the parish hall in favour of a new base in the old primary school which has been transformed into a second parish hall.
